page.title: 02INDUSTRY AND EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Up to the 1820's,Burntwood was a small hamlet.The main occupations of the 600 population was farming and nail making. Burntwood developed significantly from 1850 onwards due to mining.It was made up of two mining villages - Chase Town and Chase Terrace with an enlarged population of about 12,000. Nowadays,there are no mines - the last one closed over thirty years ago, yet the population of Burntwood has risen to over 30,000.This is due to overspill from neighbouring areas like Birmingham.The reason for moving was the proximity to Birmingham and the Black Country.
